skill.name: typescript-write
skill.description: Write TypeScript and JavaScript code following Metabase coding standards and best practices. Use when developing or refactoring TypeScript/JavaScript code.
skill.summary: Write TypeScript and JavaScript code following Metabase coding standards and best practices. Use whe...
skill.author: metabase

security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-based skill containing only markdown documentation with coding guidelines and command references. No executable code, network access, file writes, or command execution capabilities detected. The skill provides knowledge-based guidance for TypeScript/JavaScript development following Metabase standards.

content.value_statement: Developers need consistent TypeScript and JavaScript code that follows project conventions. This skill provides coding guidelines, linting commands, and testing workflows for writing maintainable code in Metabase projects.
actual_capabilities: Provides TypeScript and JavaScript coding guidelines following Metabase standards
Documents ESLint commands for code quality checks
References Prettier formatting commands for code consistency
Documents test commands for JavaScript and ClojureScript
Defines autonomous development workflow with test-driven approach
limitations: Does not execute code or run commands directly
Does not modify files without explicit user approval
Does not access project files outside the Metabase codebase
Does not provide runtime debugging or execution

use_cases.title: Write frontend TypeScript
use_cases.description: Create new TypeScript components and modules following Metabase frontend patterns and conventions

use_cases.title: Refactor JavaScript code
use_cases.description: Modernize legacy JavaScript code to TypeScript with proper type annotations and project standards

use_cases.title: Run test suites
use_cases.description: Execute targeted unit tests and linting to validate code changes before submission

prompt_templates.title: Add new feature
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a new TypeScript component following Metabase coding standards. Include proper types, tests, and follow the project development workflow.

prompt_templates.title: Fix bug
prompt_templates.prompt: Fix the TypeScript errors in the codebase. First add a failing test, then implement the fix following Metabase standards.

prompt_templates.title: Refactor code
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert this JavaScript file to TypeScript with proper type annotations. Ensure it passes linting and type checking.

prompt_templates.title: Review code
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this code change for Metabase coding standards compliance. Check that linting passes and tests are added for new functionality.

output_examples.input: Create a new TypeScript utility function for date formatting
output: I will create the utility following Metabase standards:
- Add proper TypeScript types with interfaces
- Include unit tests following the test pattern
- Ensure linting passes with yarn lint-eslint-pure

best_practices: Add failing tests before implementing new functionality to ensure test-driven development
Run linting and type checking continuously during development to catch issues early
Understand existing patterns in the codebase before implementing new features
anti_patterns: Writing code without adding corresponding tests first
Skipping linting checks before committing changes
Implementing features without reviewing existing patterns and conventions

faq.question: Which tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It provides guidelines that help AI agents write TypeScript following Metabase standards.

faq.question: What commands are available?
faq.answer: Available commands include yarn lint-eslint-pure for ESLint, yarn prettier for formatting, yarn type-check-pure for TypeScript checking, and yarn test-unit-keep-cljs for tests.

faq.question: Can this skill modify my files?
faq.answer: The skill provides guidelines and documentation. It does not execute code or modify files directly. The AI agent using this skill would need your approval for file changes.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads its own markdown documentation files. It does not access credentials, environment variables, or make network requests.

faq.question: Why are no tests running?
faq.answer: This skill documents test commands but does not execute them. The AI agent using this skill can run tests using the documented yarn commands when requested.

faq.question: How is this different from other TypeScript skills?
faq.answer: This skill is specific to Metabase coding standards, development workflow, and project-specific commands. It focuses on the Metabase codebase conventions.
